channel.title: Post your firearms!
channel.description:
Lets see those guns! Sorry brits :p
My latest and soon to be for concealed carry firearm. Smith and Wesson SD9VE 9mm. [img]http://s7.postimg.org/thbc740d7/IMAG0700.jpg[/img]
Old but gold 357 magnum for nothin but range use, tho would do the job for self defense :p. [img]http://s29.postimg.org/p5l2svkdz/357.jpg[/img]
The big boy, home self defense gun. Glock 21 .45 cal. [img]http://s12.postimg.org/bycslb23x/glock21.jpg[/img]
Pink cloth sold separately.

item.title: Post your firearms!
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Guns guns guns! No refund! ~Marcus

item.title: Post your firearms!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:28, topic:549273”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=668177.msg4468881#msg4468881 date=1421803721]

God dangit, you americans are able to own your own weapons eh… So basically you can kill unwanted visitors when they’re on your lawn/property.

It’s forbidden in germany, i’d love to have one. Mine would be a M1911 9mm.

Actually one small detail correction and I know this will sound stupid…I don’t know about other states but in the state of Georgia if you going to shoot the idiot robber you have to do it in the house because if he is already fleeing the premise outside of your home it’s considered manslaughter LOL

Shooting anyone fleeing should be manslaughter. inb4theirbackscaredme
[/quote]

Manslaughter should be accidental/recklessness. Shooting someone in the back, outside of your home, should be 2nd degree murder(maybe even 1st)[/quote]
I believe there’s a reason it’s called involuntary manslaughter, and not manslaughter.
I.E: you go to a theater and yell fire when there isn’t one. Someone dies. You go to jail because you involuntarily killed them.
But different places have different jurisdictions and terms…

Read full topic

item.title: Post your firearms!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

tL:

You can own guns in Britain.

It’s no where near as common as in America, though. And I believe (not even 80% certain) that the laws are a bit more restrictive on what you buy, but I could be totally wrong here.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your firearms!
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“Archer, post:14, topic:549273”][quote author=Spades link=topic=668177.msg4468774#msg4468774 date=1421771316]

Nice Spade!!How do you feel about the trigger pull on it? Its a little long but not too bad.

Mag shot

I don’t mind the trigger. I actually need to get mine sighted, it doesn’t shoot straight at all. My boss said he would do it for me, just had to buy a few boxes of ammo and he would do the rest
[/quote]

You can’t aim cause of trigger I would think. For me this is the hardest gun I have to shoot straight with but all because of long trigger pull like the sigma model before it. It took me 500 rounds and different trigger positions to finally learn to shoot the damn thing accurately.[/quote]

I’ve had like 10 other people shoot my gun, and they all have the same problem. Maybe it is the trigger. I haven’t noticed any problem with it though. I can try messing with him. Can’t really go shooting until the spring. Where I go to shoot is dangerous to get to in the winter.

Read full topic
